messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Re: polish question
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Rich ! It is a very nice touch in my opinion. Must be very hard to do ? - Matt ... Van: alchemyst [mailto:alchemyst@yahoo.com] Verzonden: vrijdag 16 mei
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Rich ! It is a very nice touch in my opinion. Must be very hard
to do ?

- Matt

-----Oorspronkelijk bericht-----
Van: alchemyst [mailto:alchemyst@...]
Verzonden: vrijdag 16 mei 2003 13:39
Aan: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Onderwerp: [nihontostudy] Re: polish question


--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Matthew E. Hoyle"
<matthewhoyle@w...> wrote:
> Hi guys,
>
> I noticed that some swords have the mune of the kissaki polished in
a
> similar way to the bit under the habaki with the straight lines. Is
> there any particular reason for this ?
>
>
> - Matt

Matt -

As I understand it, that's a polishers way of showing his
skill, a sort of polisher's mei if you would. Also some
polishers will only do that on better quality blades.

Rich

messages.subject: polish question
messages.msgSnippet: Hi guys, I noticed that some swords have the mune of the kissaki polished in a similar way to the bit under the habaki with the straight lines. Is there any
messages.messageBody:
Hi guys,

I noticed that some swords have the mune of the kissaki polished in a
similar way to the bit under the habaki with the straight lines. Is
there any particular reason for this ?


- Matt
